==Events==
*[[334 BC]] &ndash; The [[Macedonia (ancient kingdom)|Macedonian]] army of [[Alexander the Great]] defeats [[Darius III]] of Persia in the [[Battle of the Granicus]].
* [[853]] &ndash; A Byzantine fleet [[Sack of Damietta (853)|sacks and destroys]] undefended [[Damietta]] in [[Egypt]]
*[[1176]] &ndash; The Hashshashin ([[Assassins]]) attempt to murder [[Saladin]] near [[Aleppo]].
*[[1200]] &ndash; King [[John, King of England|John of England]] and King [[Philip II of France]] sign the [[Treaty of Le Goulet]].
*[[1246]] &ndash; [[Henry Raspe, Landgrave of Thuringia|Henry Raspe]] is elected [[anti-king]] of the [[Kingdom of Germany]], in opposition to [[Conrad IV of Germany|Conrad IV]].
*[[1254]] &ndash; [[Kingdom of Serbia (medieval)|Serbian King]] [[Stephen Uroš I of Serbia|Stephen Uroš I]] and the [[Republic of Venice]] sign a peace treaty.
*[[1377]] &ndash; [[Pope Gregory XI]] issues five [[papal bull]]s to denounce the [[doctrine]]s of [[England|English]] [[theology|theologian]] [[John Wycliffe]].
*[[1455]] &ndash; Start of the [[Wars of the Roses]]: at the [[First Battle of St Albans]], [[Richard of York, 3rd Duke of York|Richard, Duke of York]], defeats and captures King [[Henry VI of England]].
*[[1629]] &ndash; [[Holy Roman Emperor]] [[Ferdinand II, Holy Roman Emperor|Ferdinand II]] and [[List of Danish monarchs|Danish King]] [[Christian IV of Denmark|Christian IV]] sign the [[Treaty of Lübeck]] to end the Danish intervention in the [[Thirty Years' War]].
*[[1762]] &ndash; [[Sweden]] and [[Prussia]] sign the [[Treaty of Hamburg (1762)|Treaty of Hamburg]].
*[[1807]] &ndash; A [[grand jury]] indicts former [[Vice President of the United States]] [[Aaron Burr]] on a charge of [[treason]].
*  1807   &ndash; Most of the English town of [[Chudleigh]] is destroyed by fire.
*[[1809]] &ndash; On the second and last day of the [[Battle of Aspern-Essling]] (near [[Vienna]], [[Austria]]), [[Napoleon]] I is repelled by an enemy army for the first time.
*[[1816]] &ndash; A mob in [[Littleport, Cambridgeshire]], England, [[Ely and Littleport riots of 1816|riots]] over high unemployment and rising grain costs; the rioting spreads to [[Ely, Cambridgeshire|Ely]] the next day.
*[[1819]] &ndash; The {{SS|Savannah}} leaves port at [[Savannah, Georgia]], [[United States]], on a voyage to become the first [[steamship]] to cross the [[Atlantic Ocean]]. The ship arrived at [[Liverpool]], England, on [[June 20]].
*[[1826]] &ndash; {{HMS|Beagle}} departs on its first voyage.
*[[1840]] &ndash; The [[penal transportation|transportation]] of [[United Kingdom|British]] [[convict]]s to the [[New South Wales]] [[colony]] is abolished.
*[[1848]] &ndash; [[History of Martinique#1815-1899|Slavery is abolished]] in [[Martinique]].
*[[1849]] &ndash; Future [[President of the United States|U.S. President]] [[Abraham Lincoln]] is issued a [[patent]] for an [[Abraham Lincoln's patent|invention to lift boats]] over obstacles in a river, making him the only U.S. President to ever hold a patent.
*[[1856]] &ndash; [[United States House of Representatives|Congressman]] [[Preston Brooks]] of [[South Carolina]] beats [[United States Senate|Senator]] [[Charles Sumner]] with a cane in the hall of the [[United States Senate]] for a speech Sumner had made attacking [[Southern United States|Southerners]] who sympathized with the pro-[[slavery]] violence in [[Kansas]] ("[[Bleeding Kansas]]").
*[[1863]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: [[Siege of Port Hudson]] &ndash; [[Union (American Civil War)|Union]] forces begin to lay [[siege]] to the [[Confederate States of America|Confederate]]-controlled [[Port Hudson, Louisiana]].
*[[1864]] &ndash; American Civil War: After ten weeks, the [[Union Army]]'s [[Red River Campaign]] ends with the Union unable to achieve any of its objectives.
*[[1871]] &ndash; The [[United States Army|U.S. Army]] issues an order for abandonment of [[Fort Kearny]] in [[Nebraska]].
*[[1872]] &ndash; [[Reconstruction Era|Reconstruction]]: [[President of the United States|U.S. President]] [[Ulysses S. Grant]] signs the [[Amnesty Act]] into law restoring full [[civil and political rights]] to all but about 500 Confederate sympathizers.
*[[1885]] &ndash; Prior to burial in the [[Panthéon]], the body of [[Victor Hugo]] was exposed under the [[Arc de Triomphe]] during the night.
*[[1897]] &ndash; The [[Blackwall Tunnel]] under the [[River Thames]] is officially opened
*[[1903]] &ndash; Launch of the [[White Star Line]]r, {{SS|Ionic}}.
*  1906   &ndash; The [[Wright brothers]] are granted U.S. patent number 821,393 for their "[[Airplane|Flying-Machine]]".
*[[1915]] &ndash; [[Lassen Peak]] erupts with a powerful force, and is the only mountain other than [[Mount St. Helens]] to erupt in the contiguous US during the 20th century.
*  1915   &ndash; Three trains collide in the [[Quintinshill rail disaster]] near [[Gretna Green]], [[Scotland]], killing 227 people and injuring 246; the accident is found to be the result of non-standard operating practices during a shift change at a busy junction.
*[[1926]] &ndash; [[Chiang Kai-shek]] replaces communists in [[Kuomintang]], [[China]].
*[[1939]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[Germany]] and [[Italy]] sign the [[Pact of Steel]].
*[[1942]] &ndash; [[Mexico]] enters World War II on the side of the [[Allies of World War II|Allies]].
*  1942   &ndash; The [[Steel Workers Organizing Committee]] disbands, and a new [[trade union]], the [[United Steelworkers]], is formed.
*  1942   &ndash; World War II: [[Ted Williams]] of the [[Boston Red Sox]] enlists in the [[United States Marine Corps]] as a flight instructor.
*[[1943]] &ndash; [[Joseph Stalin]] disbands [[Comintern]].
*[[1945]] &ndash; [[Operation Paperclip]] &ndash; United States Army Major Robert B. Staver recommends that the U.S. evacuate German scientists and engineers to help in the development of [[rocket]] technology.
*[[1947]] &ndash; [[Cold War]]: in an effort to fight the spread of [[Communism]], the U.S. President [[Harry S. Truman]] signs an act into law that will later be called the [[Truman Doctrine]]. The act grants [[United States dollar|$]]400&nbsp;million in military and economic aid to [[Turkey]] and [[Greece]], each battling an internal Communist movement.
*[[1958]] &ndash; [[1958 riots in Ceylon|Sri Lankan riots of 1958]]: This riot is a watershed event in the race relationship of the various ethnic communities of Sri Lanka. The total number of deaths is estimated to be 300, mostly Sri Lankan [[Tamil people|Tamils]].
*[[1960]] &ndash; An [[earthquake]] measuring 9.5 on the [[moment magnitude scale]], now known as the [[1960 Valdivia earthquake|Great Chilean Earthquake]], hits southern [[Chile]]. It is the most powerful earthquake ever recorded.
*[[1961]] &ndash; An [[1961 New South Wales earthquake|earthquake]] rocks New South Wales.
*[[1962]] &ndash; [[Continental Airlines Flight 11]] crashes after bombs explode on board.
*[[1963]] &ndash; An assassination attempt of Greek left-wing politician [[Grigoris Lambrakis]], who will die five days later.
*[[1964]] &ndash; The U.S. President [[Lyndon B. Johnson]] announces the goals of his [[Great Society]] social reforms to bring an "end to poverty and racial injustice" in America.
*[[1967]] &ndash; The [[L'Innovation Department Store fire|L'Innovation]] department store in the center of [[Brussels]], [[Belgium]], burns down. It is the most devastating fire in Belgian history, resulting in 323 dead and missing and 150 injured.
*  1967   &ndash; [[Vietnam War]]: [[Vinh Xuan massacre]].
*[[1968]] &ndash; The nuclear-powered [[submarine]] the {{USS|Scorpion|SSN-589|6}} sinks with 99 men aboard 400 miles southwest of the [[Azores]].
*[[1969]] &ndash; ''[[Apollo 10]]'' 's lunar module flies within 8.4 [[nautical mile]]s (16&nbsp;km) of the [[moon]]'s surface.
*[[1972]] &ndash; Ceylon adopts a new [[constitution]], thus becoming a [[Republic]], changes its name to [[Sri Lanka]], and joins the [[Commonwealth of Nations]].
*[[1980]] &ndash; [[Namco]] releases the highly influential [[arcade game]] ''[[Pac-Man]]''.
*[[1987]] &ndash; [[Hashimpura massacre]] in [[Meerut]], [[India]].
*  1987   &ndash;  First ever [[1987 Rugby World Cup|Rugby World Cup]] kicks off with [[New Zealand Rugby Union|New Zealand]] playing [[Italy national rugby union team|Italy]] at [[Eden Park]] in [[Auckland]], [[New Zealand]].
*[[1990]] &ndash; [[Yemen Arab Republic|North]] and [[South Yemen]] are unified to create the Republic of [[Yemen]].
*  1990   &ndash; [[Microsoft]] releases the [[Windows 3.0]] [[operating system]].
*[[1992]] &ndash; After 30 years, 66-year-old [[Johnny Carson]] hosts ''[[The Tonight Show Starring Johnny Carson|The Tonight Show]]'' for the last time.
*  1992   &ndash; [[Bosnia and Herzegovina]], [[Croatia]] and [[Slovenia]] join the [[United Nations]].
*[[1997]] &ndash; [[Kelly Flinn incident|Kelly Flinn]], the [[United States Air Force|US Air Force]]'s first female bomber pilot certified for combat, accepts a [[general discharge]] in order to avoid a [[court-martial]].
*[[1998]] &ndash; [[Lewinsky scandal]]: a federal judge rules that [[United States Secret Service]] agents can be compelled to testify before a [[grand jury]] concerning the scandal, involving [[President]] [[Bill Clinton]].
*[[2002]] &ndash; In [[Washington, D.C.]], the remains of the missing [[Chandra Levy]] are found in [[Rock Creek Park]].
*  2002   &ndash; [[American civil rights movement]]: a jury in [[Birmingham, Alabama]], convicts former [[Ku Klux Klan]] member [[Bobby Frank Cherry]] of the [[1963]] murders of four girls in the [[16th Street Baptist Church bombing|bombing of the 16th Street Baptist Church]].
*[[2003]] &ndash; In [[Fort Worth, Texas]], [[Annika Sörenstam]] becomes the first woman to play the [[PGA Tour]] in 58 years.
*[[2004]] &ndash; The U.S. town of [[Hallam, Nebraska]] is wiped out by a powerful [[Fujita scale#F4|F4]] [[tornado]] (part of the [[May 2004 tornado outbreak sequence]]) which kills one resident, and becomes the widest tornado on record at {{convert|2.5|mi}} wide; a record that wouldn't be broken until a the [[May 26–31, 2013 tornado outbreak|El Reno tornado]] on May 31, 2013.
*[[2008]] &ndash; The [[Late-May 2008 tornado outbreak sequence]] unleashes 235 [[tornado]]es, including an [[Enhanced Fujita scale|EF4]] and an [[Enhanced Fujita scale|EF5]] tornado, between May 22 and May 31, 2008. The tornadoes strike 19 [[U.S. state|state]]s and one [[Canadian province]].
*[[2010]] &ndash; An [[Air India Express]] [[Boeing 737]] [[Air India Express Flight 812|goes over a cliff and crashes]] upon landing at [[Mangalore]], [[India]], killing 158 of the 166 people on board.  It is the worst crash involving a Boeing 737.
*[[2011]] &ndash; [[2011 Joplin tornado|An EF5 tornado]] strikes [[Joplin, Missouri]], killing 162 people and wreaking $2.8 billion worth in damage&mdash;the costliest and seventh-deadliest single tornado in U.S. history.
*[[2012]] &ndash; [[Tokyo Skytree]] is opened to public. It is the [[List of tallest towers in the world|tallest tower in world]] (634 m), and the second tallest man-made structure on Earth, after [[Burj Khalifa]] (829.8 m).
*[[2014]] &ndash; General [[Prayuth Chan-ocha]] of the [[Royal Thai Armed Forces]] announces a military [[2014 Thai coup d'état|coup d'état]], following six months of political turmoil.
*  2014   &ndash; An [[May 2014 Ürümqi attack|explosion]] occurs in the city of [[Ürümqi]], the capital of China's far-western [[Xinjiang Uyghur Autonomous Region]], resulting in at least 43 deaths and 91 injuries.
